p: The Mediterranean-type ecosystem brings several changes in the climate, such as warmer and dryer conditions, excessive water demand, and extreme rainfall variability [ 32, 66, 67]. As stated by [ 68], in the Mediterranean Basin climate change decade by decade, causing a downward trend in precipitation (−15%) and an annual temperature increase (0.5 °C). According to [ 66, 67], during the last 50 years, Italy recorded a rainfall reduction of about 135 mm. It is expected that in the future the water-stressed regions will grow in all Mediterranean countries. Climate projections identified a significant increase in heat accumulation and a lowering in chilling accumulation in Portugal [ 20].
